bullets.text: Fed delivers third 25 bp cut; SEP signals gradual disinflation; policymakers most divided in years on 2026 rate path.
Employment Cost Index: compensation costs rose 0.8% Q3 2025; up 3.5% year-over-year, indicating cooling but persistent wage pressures.
U.S. seizes oil tanker near Venezuela amid sanctions enforcement; ship previously spoofed location, heightening tensions and potential risks to illicit oil flows.
U.S. imposes new 15% tariff ceiling, retroactive to mid-November, Swiss government says—adding uncertainty to transatlantic trade costs.
Oracle revenue miss wipes out AI momentum; stock down double-digits, pressuring Nvidia and CoreWeave on hyperscaler spending concerns.
Nvidia reportedly testing chip-tracking as reports allege China’s DeepSeek uses banned Blackwell GPUs, underscoring export-control challenges.
FHA refinance demand jumps 24% as borrowers rush to capture savings following Fed’s latest cut.
Beef prices surge put restaurants in ‘code red,’ signaling stubborn food inflation and margin pressures.
Australia enforces world-first under-16 social media ban, intensifying global regulatory scrutiny of platforms.
Deep ocean fixes carbon in unexpected ways, suggesting stronger long-term sequestration and adjustments to climate models.
Evidence for a new state of matter in Earth’s core reshapes understanding of planetary interiors and heat transport.
Blood biomarkers show obesity accelerates Alzheimer’s progression, strengthening metabolic-health focus in dementia prevention.
